confirmed_facts: Fire occurred at a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, Hong Kong on 26 November 2025 at approximately 2:50â€¯pm local time.
At least 13 people died, including one firefighter, and about 10 people were injured.
The complex had 2,000 units with roughly 4,800 residents; 7 of the 8 blocks were engulfed in flames.
Bamboo scaffolding used for maintenance work was present and contributed to the fireâ€™s spread.
Firefighters classified the incident as a 5â€‘level (maximum) fire and are still conducting rescue operations.

timeline.event: Fire broke out in a highâ€‘rise apartment complex in Tai Po, Hong Kong.
